regulations.rule_name: General Rules for All Non-Dwelling Accessory Structures

qualifiers.scope: Applies to all accessory structures on a lot.
qualifiers.notes: There are no minimum lot size requirements for non-dwelling accessory structures.

variables.name: use
variables.description: The purpose of the structure, which must be incidental to the main dwelling.
variables.ambiguous_language: The term 'incidental' is not defined and is subject to interpretation.

variables.name: total_lot_coverage
variables.description: The percentage of a lot that is covered by buildings.

variables.name: total_gross_floor_area
variables.description: The total floor area of all buildings on a lot.

mandatory.description: Must have a use that is incidental to the main dwelling.
Must be detached from the main dwelling.
Must be at least 3 feet from the main dwelling.
Counts toward the total lot coverage.

then.description: Counts towards total gross floor area.

exceptions.description: Structures less than 120 sf do not require a building permit.
exceptions.reference: See rule: 'Permit Exception for Small Accessory Structures'

relationships.hierarchical: This is the base rule set for all other non-dwelling accessory structure rules on this page.

qualifiers.scope: Applies only to accessory structures located in the 'buildable area' of a lot.
ambiguous_terms: buildable area (definition not provided on this page)

variables.name: height
variables.description: The height of the accessory structure.

variables.name: daylight_plane
variables.description: The daylight plane regulation applicable to the accessory structure.

mandatory.description: Are subject to the same height and daylight plane regulations as the main dwelling.

relationships.hierarchical: Sub-rule of 'General Rules for All Non-Dwelling Accessory Structures'. Inherits all conditions from the parent rule.
logical_dependencies: The regulations for height and daylight plane are dependent on the regulations for the 'main dwelling', which are not specified on this page.

qualifiers.scope: Applies only to accessory structures located in the 'required setback' of a lot.
ambiguous_terms: required setback (definition not provided on this page)
through lot (definition not provided on this page)

mandatory.description: May not be located in the front yard.
May not be located in the street-side yard.
May not be located in the rear yard of a through lot.
May not cover more than 50% of the rear yard.
May not be used for sleeping or living.
Are subject to the accessory-structure height and daylight plane regulations.

then.description: Counts towards total gross floor area.
May have no more than two plumbing fixtures.

relationships.hierarchical: Sub-rule of 'General Rules for All Non-Dwelling Accessory Structures'. Inherits all conditions from the parent rule.

cross_references.topic: accessory-structure height and daylight plane regulations

regulations.rule_name: Permit Exception for Small Accessory Structures

qualifiers.scope: Applies to accessory structures with an area less than the specified threshold.

mandatory.description: Must still comply with all zoning regulations, even if a permit is not required.

exceptions.description: This rule defines an exception to the general building permit requirement based on structure size.

logical_dependencies: This rule modifies the 'building permit' condition found in 'General Rules for All Non-Dwelling Accessory Structures' and 'Accessory Structures in Required Setback'.
